1516741810_1AnFGL613gYqFWm4Lhwdk6x5gCRe1.body:
> subreddits (this is optional as you can have as many zerotalks as you want, if you just clone it)

The problem is that if they are all scattered around in different clones, the various communities will be scattered as well, where reddit wins is that there's a subreddit pretty much for everything/everyone on the same location and browsing between subreddits is dead easy and that's I think the recipe we might want to clone in this case, not scatter stuff around for the sake of it.

> I think forking zerotalk would be a good starting place. (its pretty and consistent design wise with other apps)

Whats missing the most (in my view):

    replies under each message
    sorting replies by upvotes
    sorting in the main window by upvotes + time decay

Good starting point(s) indeed !

> If someone wants to clone the github repo I can work on that as well

I'm really not a WebDev although I know a bit of HTML/CSS but I will be happy to test/debug :)

> If someone wants to clone the github repo I can work on that as well, as soon as I figure out how not to doxx myself immediately by commiting code.

Isolate your identities fully if possible (GitHub acc, SSH keys, ...), perhaps work from a Virtual Machine ?

I've (personally) not much real use for it but I find the idea of having a web browser helper really cool, kudos to you for developing it ! I took a look at the code and it looks very sane.

Now if it could notify me of any news In my feed in ZeroHello using notifications bubbles, I would install it in a heartbeat :)
